products: Soda, energy drinks, and RTD tea to which one or more added caloric sweeteners has been added, and containing at least 2 calories per fluid ounce.

update_detail: Rate lowered from 24% to 4% on 16/04/1996 (Decree No. 404/96); increased to 8% on some beverage categories on 01/01/2000, remained at 4% on others.
products: Non-alcoholic beverages, carbonated or not; less than 100% fruit and vegetable juices; syrups for soft drinks, extracts and concentrates that due to their preparation and commercial presentation are sold for domestic consumption or in public places (bars, confectioneries, etc.), with or without the addition of water, soda or other beverages; and products intended for the preparation of non-alcoholic beverages not specifically covered for other internal taxes, whether natural or artificial, solid or liquid; mineral waters, mineralized or flavored, or not

products: Domestic: Carbonated SSB and energy drinks. Imports: All SSB and non-SSB, except concentrates

products: Carbonated soft drinks, energy drinks, sports drinks, flavored milk, sweetened juice drinks, concentrates

products: All soft drinks, including nonalcoholic drinks and water containing added sugar or other sweeteners or flavors; flavored waters without added sugar or other sweeteners (plain, unflavored water excluded)
exclusions: Plain water, all fruit and vegetable juices under HS headings 2009 (whether sweetened or not), all milk and dairy products, and milk alternatives (soy, rice etc)
rate: €0.12 per liter on waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters containing added sugar or other sweetening matter; €0.068 per liter on flavored unsweetened waters; €0.41 per liter on liquid concentrates without added sugar/sweetener intended for the use of manufacturing soft drinks; €0.72 per liter on liquid concentrates with added sugar/sweetener; €0.68 per kg on unsweetened powders intended for the use of manufacturing soft drinks; €1.19 per kg on sweetened powders; €0.7 per kg on extracts, essences, and preparations based on coffee (HS 2101)

products: Waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters, either containing or not containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoured and other nonalcoholic beverages (HS 2201 and 2202)

update_detail: Rate increase (excl. diet drinks) from 33.5% to 50% in Oct 2018, to 75% in April 2019
products: Waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters, containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoring, and other nonalcoholic beverages (HS 2202); Preparations for making beverages, containing added sugar (HS 2106.901); Syrups containing added sugar (HS 2106.909)

update_detail: Rate lowered from 27% to 4% in 2017 on flavored waters, juice drinks,  nectars, carbonates, low-calorie carbonates, energy drinks, and sports drinks; rate lowered from 20% to 4% in 2018 on concentrates and syrups, increased to 12% in 2019, lowered to 4% in 2021, to 2.6% in 2022; rate increased to 8% in 2022 on concentrates used for preparation of SSB under heading 2202.
products: Waters (whether sweetened or not), carbonates, sports drinks, energy drinks, concentrates
exclusions: Juices, coconut and other plant waters, soy milk, RTD tea and coffee
rate: 2.6% on beverages under HS 2202, and carbonated unsweetened waters under 2201; 8% on concentrates under heading 2016.90.10 for preparing drinks of heading 2202 2
legislation: Imposto Sobre Produtos Industrializados (IPI) established by Consitutional Amendment No. 18 of Dec 1, 1965; Lei No. 5.368 of 1st December 1967; Decreto-Lei nº 116-A, de 27 de janeiro de 1967. Altera alíquotas do Imposto sôbre Produtos Industrializados [Decree-Law No. 116-A, of January 27, 1967. Changes the rates of Tax on Industrialized Products]; Decreto nº 11.158/2022 Aprova a Tabela de Incidência do Imposto sobre Produtos Industrializados - TIPI; Decreto nº 11.182/2022 Altera a Tabela de Incidência do Imposto sobre Produtos Industrializados - TIPI, aprovada pelo Decreto nº 11.158, de 29 de julho de 2022. IPI rates vary by product and are higher on 'non-essentials' like tobacco and alcohol products, and perfumes. Functions like a VAT-type tax for some products in that the amount paid in earlier production stages can be used as tax credits in later production stages. SSB manufacturers located in the Manaus Duty-Free Zone are exempt from paying IPI and receive IPI accumulated credits that can be used to pay other federal taxes.
notes: IPI is a federal excise tax levied on most imported and manufactured products

products: Soda beverages (carbonated or effervescent beverages that have bubbles or fizz and contain sugar, naturally occurring sweeteners, added natural sweeteners, or artificial sweeteners)
exclusions: Plain bottled water (still and carbonated), sparkling flavored waters that contain no sweeteners, still fruit juices (not carbonated), frozen sweetened beverages that are not carbonated
rate: 7% Provincial Sales Tax (PST)
legislation: British Columbia Provincial Sales Tax Act 2012
notes: All food products and non-soda beverages are exempt from Provincial Sales Tax

update_detail: Extended to cover all SSB on 1st Oct 2016; minimum sugar content threshold introduced in July 2022
products: All SSB, including juices, milk-based beverages, milk alternatives, and concentrates with total sugar content >4 grams per 100ml
rate: MUR 0.06 per gram sugar on SSB with total sugar content >4 grams per 100ml
legislation: The Finance Act 2013, Excise Act amended
notes: Tax also applies to non-staple sugar-sweetened food products with sugar content >4g per 100g as of 1 July 2022

products: Non-alcoholic beverages with added sugar
exclusions: Milks and yoghurt drinks (where milk is primary/first ingredient), LCSBs, 100% fruit and vegetable juices, plain water
rate: MXN 1.3996 per liter on all SSB except energy drinks and concentrates used to prepare them; 25% on energy drinks and concentrates, powders and syrups used to prepare them
legislation: Ley del Impuesto Especial Sobre Producción y Servicios de 30 diciembre de 1980, DOF 11-12-2013, DOF 12-11-2021
notes: 8% excise tax also applies to food with high calorie density ≥275 kcals per 100 g

products: Non-alcoholic beverages under HS 2009 and 2202, including beverages containing synthetic sweeteners or added sugars
rate: Starting at €3.0 per hl on beverages containing less than or equal to 1kg added sugars per hl, up to €24.34 per hl on beverages containing 15kg added sugars per hl plus €2.07 per hl for each additional kg; €3.11 per hl on beverages containing synthetic sweeteners
legislation: Ordonnance Souveraine n° 6.932 du 14 mai 2018 modifiant l'Ordonnance Souveraine n° 3.653 du 30 janvier 2012; Arrêté Ministériel No. 2018 64 du 30 janvier 2018 fixant les tarids des droits d'accises
notes: Adjusted annually

products: Carbonated waters with added sugar or other sweeteners under HS2202 10 00
rate: €10 per hl
legislation: Law on Excise Taxes 01-3868/2

products: Lemonades, carbonated or non-carbonated water, mineral water, table water or others, flavored or unflavored
rate: Carbonated or non-carbonated water, mineral water, table water or other, flavored by addition of  <10% edible fruit juice or its equivalent in concentrated juice, and on lemonades prepared with <6% lemon juice or its equivalent in concentrated juices: MAD 30 per hl on beverages containing 5g/100ml or less of added sugar, MAD 40 per hl on beverages containing between 5g/100ml and 10g per 100ml, and MAD 45 per hl on beverages containing 10g per 100ml or more of added sugar; Carbonated or non-carbonated water, mineral water, table or other waters, flavored by adding 10% or more of edible fruit juice or its equivalent in concentrated juice, and on lemonades prepared with 6% or more of lemon juice or its equivalent in concentrated juice - MAD 10 per hl on beverages containing 5g/100ml or less of added sugar, MAD 12.5 per hl on beverages containing between 5g/100ml and 10g per 100ml, and MAD 15 per hl on beverages containing 10g per 100ml or more of added sugar; MAD 600 per hl on energy drinks with a caffeine content of more than 14.5 mg/100 ml and less than 32 mg/100 ml, with the addition of other stimulating substances such as taurine, glucoronolactone, guarana, ginseng, or any other plant extract, where appropriate)
legislation: Loi de finances pour l’année budgétaire 2020.

products: Sweetened waters under HS2202
rate: 1 Mt/L
legislation: Codigo do Imposto Sobre Consumos Específicos

products: Non-alcoholic beverages other than: unsweetened water, soymilk, unflavored milk, and drinks sweetened other than with sugar
exclusions: Unsweetened water, LCSB, soymilk, unflavored milk
legislation: Customs Tariff Act 1997-2006; Customs Tariff (Amendment) Act 2007; Customs (Rates of Duty) Act 2010; Customs Tariff Schedule 2014
notes: Tax also applies to sugar, confectionery, and high-sugar foods.

update_detail: Extended beyond Dec 2020 and re-authorised as a permanent law; "unhealthy food and beverages" replaced with "minimal-to-no-nutritional value food"
products: Non-alcoholic sweetened beverages, whether sweetened with caloric or non-caloric sweeteners
exclusions: Plain milk, yoghurt-based drinks, flavored and unflavored water without sweetener, non-dairy milk alternatives
legislation: Healthy Diné Nation Act 2014, as amended through CD-96-20
notes: Tax also applies to candy, chips, sweetened baked goods, frozen desserts

update_detail: Rate increase on energy drinks, from Rs. 36/L to Rs. 50/L
rate: Rs.11/L on fruit and vegetable juices, whether or not containing added sugar or other sweetening matter (HS 2009); Rs. 50/L on energy drinks (HS 2202.99.10); Rs. 14/L on other SSB under HS 2202.99.90; Rs. 20/L on non-alcoholic beer (2202.91.00)
legislation: Excise Duty Act, 2002 as amended by Financial Act, 2021 (2078) and Financial Act, 2022

update_detail: Blank run' from 1/4/17-30/9/19; Entry into full force 1/10/18
products: All SSB under HS 2202 (excluding soy milk under HS 2202.99.90), 2106, and 2009
exclusions: Plain water (HS 2201), plain unsweetened milk, soy milk
rate: 22% (highest rate of General Consumption Tax)
legislation: Taxe Générale sur la Consommation, Loi du pays no. 2016-14 du 30 Septembre 2016
notes: TGC is 4-tiered: Highest rate (22%) applies to SSB, alcoholic beverages, tobacco, computor devices, motor vehicles, boats etc. 'Reduced' rate of 3% applies to 'everyday food products'. All other products not included in reduced or higher rate are taxed at 'normal' rate of 11%. Some products are exempt.

products: SSB under HS2202; 2009; 2106
exclusions: Unsweetened water (carbonated or not), soy milk; All products of EU origin
rate: 10% on SSB under HS 2202 and 2106; 5% on juices under HS 2009; unsweetened water exempt
legislation: New Caledonia Customs Code (updated 2021); Délibération n° 208 du 14 janvier 2022 portant tarif des douanes de Nouvelle-Calédonie et portant diverses dispositions d’ordre fiscal; Taxe Générale sur la Consommation, Loi du pays no. 2016-14 du 30 Septembre 2016
notes: https://dsf.gouv.nc/la-dsf-propos/le-code-des-impots

products: SSB, including sweetened fruit-flavored juices, sweetened iced tea and lemonades, sweetened sports and energy drinks,and dispensed beverages such as sweetened soda fountain drinks
exclusions: 100% juices, milk-based drinks, sweetened dairy alternatives, yoghurt drinks, LCSB, plain water
rate:
CAD$0.20/L on ready-to-drink beverages to which the manufacturer has added sugar such as regular soft-drinks, sweetened fruit-flavoured juices, sweetened iced-tea and lemonades, sweetened sports and energy drinks, and dispensed beverages such as sweetened soda fountain drinks, slush drinks and fruit juices. $0.20 per liter (based on manufacturer's recommended mixing ratios for finished product) on concentrated drink mixtures, including frozen concentrated sweetened fruit punches, sweetened flavoured drink crystals and powders, and flavoured syrups to which the manufacturer has added sugar. These also include concentrates used to produce dispensed beverages (e.g. post-mix).Where the manufacturer does not provide sufficient directions for finished beverage preparation and/or volume:
$0.80 per liter for frozen concentrated juices,
$2.00 per kilogram for flavoured powders, and
$1.20 per liter for syrups
legislation: Sugar Sweetened Beverage Tax (SSBT), Regulation 60/21 of 28th October 2021, Amendment to Revenue Administraction Act
notes: https://www.assembly.nl.ca/legislation/sr/annualregs/2021/nr210060.htm

products: All non-alcoholic beverages, sweetened or not-sweetened, carbonated or not
rate: 11% on carbonated unsweetened water and SSB under HS 2202; 10% on concentrates; 9% on juices and non-carbonated unsweetened water
legislation: Ley de Concertación Tributaria N 987, 2019

products: Non-alcoholic beverages under HS 2202 and 2101 (extracts, essences, and concentrates of tea and coffee)
rate: 15% on beverages under HS heading 2202; 10% on extracts, essences and concentrates of tea and coffee (HS 21.01)
legislation: Loi no. 2019-76 du 31 décembre 2019 portant loi de finances pour l´année budgétaire 2020; Loi 2015-38 modifiant la Code Général des Impôts

products: Non-alcoholic carbonated and sugar-sweetened beverages, including fruit or vegetable juice (whether or not containing sugar or other sweetener), carbonated water containing sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoured, energy drinks, malt drinks, concentrates
exclusions: Unsweetened water, beverages containing at least 75% milk, manufacturers producing <5000 L of non-alcoholic beverages per year
rate: NGN 10/L
legislation: 2021 Finance Act 2021, amending the Customs, Excise Tariffs, etc (Consolidated) Act, 2004 (“CETA”); Excise Duty (Non-Alcoholic, Carbonated and Sweetened Beverages) Regulations, 2022

products: SSB under HS2202, excluding milk-based drinks
exclusions: Plain water, flavored water, flavored milk
legislation: The Niue Customs Tariff Order 1969; Customs Tariff Act 1982; Niue Customs and Tariff (General Amendment) Regulations 2016

products: Soft drinks, meaning any readily drinkable carbonated or non-carbonated nonalcoholic beverage, other than drinkable dairy products, 100% fruit or vegetable juices, and bottled drinking water
rate: US$0.005 per fl oz
legislation: Public Law No. 9-22, Ch 4, Art 2, 1994

products: Any beverage to which one or more caloric sweeteners have been added and that contains ≥25 kcals per 12 fluid ounce. Includes sodas, sports drinks, sweetened teas, and energy drinks
exclusions: Milk-based drinks, LCSB, 100% fruit and/or vegetable juice
rate: US¢1 per ounce
legislation: Ord No. 86161, Sugar Sweetened Beverage Product Distribution Tax

update_detail: Rate increased and extended to cover all SSB (previously applied only to carbonated and energy drinks)
products: All types of juices, sports drinks, fruit/malt syrups, pre-mixed ready to serve coffee and tea drinks, which contains sugar or any of its derivatives (regardless of the percentage of sugar contained); concentrates, powders, gels, extracts or any other forms that can be converted into sweetened drinks
exclusions: Unsweetened waters, 100% juice, milk and other dairy products that contain at least 75% milk
rate: 100% on energy drinks; 50% on all ready-to-drink beverages that contain added sugar or other sweeteners as well as concentrates, powder, gel, or extracts intended to be made into an SSB
legislation: National Excise Tax Law Decree 23/2019

products: Carbonated waters whether or not containing added sugar or other sweetening matter; concentrates intendeded for their preparation
rate: 13% on carbonated waters, sweetened and unsweetened; 50% on concentrates
legislation: Federal Excise Act 2005; Supplementary Finance Bill 2021; Finance (Supplementary) Act, 2022

update_detail: Rate increase from 5% on soft drinks and 6% on concentrates
products: All nonalcoholic beverages containing added free sugars or caloric sweeteners, and concentrated syrups
exclusions: Dairy, grain, and cereal-based beverages, natural fruit juices and concentrates, or products with <7.5 g sugar per 100 ml
rate: 7% on carbonated SSB; 5% on other nonalcoholic SSB; 10% on syrups and concentrates used to produce sugary drinks
legislation: Ley N 45, 14 nov 1995; Ley N 114 of 18 nov 2019
notes: Revenue earmarked for health, education, and agricultural development  (Ley N 114 of 18 nov 2019, Art. 11)

products: Soda and beverages, whether or not sweetened, without alcohol or with max 2% alcohol; including juices

update_detail: From April 1999 to Dec 2006, 19% applied to consumption of specific "luxury" goods, including carbonated soda and bottled water (carbonated and non-carbonated) . On 29 Dec 2006, bottled water was exempted from the ISC, and non-carbonated soft drinks, energy drinks, and sports drinks were added to the list of products covered by the tax . All dairy-based drinks and juices remained exempt. In May 2018, rate raised from 17% to 25% on all SSB (incl. non-alcoholic beer) containing 6g sugar or more per 100 ml. In June 2019, rate lowered from 17% to 12%  for SSBs containing 0.5 g sugar or less per 100 ml. In Sept 2021, upper threshold was lowered to 5 grams sugar/100ml.
products: Nonalcoholic beverages, sweetened waters, and 0% alcohol beer
exclusions: Plain water, 100% juice, plain milk, drinkable yoghurts (incl. sweetened)
rate: 25% on beverages with ≥6 g sugar per 100 ml, 17% on drinks with 0.5-6g sugar per 100ml, 12% on drinks with <0.5g sugar per 100ml
legislation: Impuesto Selectivo al Consumo (ISC) introduced by Titulo II - Decreto Supremo N 055-99-EF, April, 15, 1999; Decreto Supremo 216-2006-EF; Decreto Supremo N 091-2018-EF, 9 May 2018; Supreme Decree 266-2021-EF
notes: https://www.globalfoodresearchprogram.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Peru-SSB-Tax-Law-2018-EN-TRANSLATION-SCG.pdf

products: Any nonalcoholic beverage with caloric sugar-based sweetener or artificial sugar substitute listed as an ingredient, including soda, non-100% fruit and vegetable drinks, sports drinks, flavored water, energy drinks, pre-sweetened coffee or tea, and nonalcoholic beverages intended to be mixed into an alcoholic drink; also, syrups or other concentrates used in beverages (incl. coffee syrups distributed to coffee shops), pre-packaged beverages made with “natural” sweeteners, such as agave, honey, or stevia. Any non-alcoholic beverage, and any non-alcoholic syrup or other concentrate that is intended to be used in the preparation of a beverage, that lists as an ingredient: any form of caloric sugar-based sweetener, including, but not limited to, sucrose, glucose or high fructose corn syrup; or  any form of artificial sugar substitute, including stevia, aspartame, sucralose, neotame, acesulfame potassium (Ace-K), saccharin, and advantame.
exclusions: Milk-based drinks, 100% fruit and/or vegetable juices
rate: US¢1.5 per ounce
legislation: Sugar Sweetened Beverage Tax, Bill No. 160176

products: Beverages made with caloric and non-caloric sweeteners, including sweetened juice drinks, sweetened tea, all carbonated beverages, flavoured water,energy and sports drinks, powdered drinks not classified as milk, juice, tea or coffee, cereal and grain beverages, and other non-alcoholic beverages that contain added sugar
exclusions: All milk products whether sweetened or not, including plain milk, infant formula milk, follow-on milk, growing-up milk, powdered milk, ready-to-drink milk, flavoured milk, fermented milk, soy milk and flavoured soy milk; 100% natural fruit and vegetables juices without added sugar or caloric sweeteners; meal-replacement and medically indicated beverages; ground coffee, instant soluble coffee and prepackaged powdered coffee products; and beverages sweetened with coconut sap or stevia glycosides.
rate: PHP 6 per liter (around US$0.12) on drinks containing sugar and artificial sweeteners; PHP 12 per liter (around US$0.24) on drinks containing HFCS
legislation: Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN) Law, Republic Act No. 10963 of 24th July 2017

products: Non-alcoholic drinks containing added sugar or artificial sweeteners, caffeine or taurine
exclusions: Sports/isotonic drinks with sugar content ≤5g sugar/100mL, juice products with content of no less than 20 per cent of fruit or vegetable juice with max. sugar content of 5 g/100 ml, and beverages with milk or milk products as the first/primary ingredient
rate: PLN 0.50 per L base fee; Additional PLN 0.05 per gram sugar >5g/100ml; Additional PLN 0.09 per L on drinks containing caffeine or taurine; Total soda fee cannot exceed PLN 1.2 per L; Juice drinks with >20% juice content and isotonic sports drinks with >5g sugar/100mL not charged base fee of PLN 0.5 per L.
legislation: Ustawa z dnia 14 lutego 2020 r. o zmianie niektórych ustaw w związku z promocją prozdrowotnych wyborów konsumentów [Amending certain acts in connection with the promotion of health-promoting choices of consumers]

products: Mineral, flavored, and carbonated waters containing added sugar or sweeteners under HS 2202; concentrates in liquid, powder or solid form intended for the preparation of beverages under HS 2202
rate: 1.05€/hl on products containing <25g sugar per L; 6.32€/hl on products containing 25-50g sugar per L; 8.42€/hl on SSB containing 50-80 g sugar/l; 21.07€/hl on SSB containing  ≥80 g sugar/l. Liquid concentrates: 6.32€/hl, 37.93€/hl , 50.56€/hl and 126.42€/hl, depending on sugar content, respectively (<25g per L, 25-50g per L, 50-80g per L, ≥80g per L); Powder concentrates: 10.54€/hl, 63.21€/hl , 84.28€/hl and 210.71€/hl, per 100kg net weight, depending on sugar content, respectively (<25g per L, 25-50g per L, 50-80g per L, ≥80g per L)
legislation: Diário da República nº 248/2016 Série I de 2016-12-28. Lei 42/2016. Orçamento do Estado para 2017. Secção III. Impostos especiais de consumo. Artigo 211. Imposto sobre o álcool, as bebidas alcoólicas e as bebidas adicionadas de açúcar ou outros edulcorantes (IABA). 2016 Dec 28. Artigo 247.º do/a Lei n.º 114/2017 - Diário da República n.º 249/2017, Série I de 2017-12-29, em vigor a partir de 2018-01-01. Lei n.º 24-D/2022, de 30 de dezembro

products: Carbonated waters with added sugar, other sweeteners or flavours; energy drinks; concentrates, powder, gel or extracts intended to be made into carbonated waters or energy drinks

notes: Reduced (9%) or super-reduced (5%) VAT rate apply to all other food products and non-alcoholic beverages

update_detail: Rate lowered on 100% juices from 39% to 5%

products: Any nonalcoholic beverage intended for human consumption that contains added caloric sweetener and contains >25 calories per 12 fl. oz. of beverage, including but not limited to all drinks and beverages commonly referred to as soda, pop, cola, soft drinks, sports drinks, energy drinks, sweetened ice teas, or any other similar names; syrups and powders that can be made into SSB, for example, fountain drinks from beverage-dispensing machines.

rate: 20% on products under HS 2202.90, 20% with 10% surchage on products under HS 2106.90; 10% on products under HS 2009 and 2202.10

update_detail: Extended to cover all SSB (initially applied only to energy drinks)

exclusions: Any beverage with <40 kcals per 12 ounce serving; any beverage with milk as the principal ingredient or in which water and grains, nuts, legumes, or seeds constitute the first two ingredients in the product ingredient list; any beverage consisting of 100% natural fruit or vegetable juice with no added sweetener; any concentrate that the consumer combines with other ingredients to create a beverage.
rate: US¢1.75 per ounce (for manufacturers grossing >$5m annual worldwide income); ¢1.0 per ounce for manufacturers grossing >$2 million and <$5 million in worldwide income. Products made by manufacturers grossing $2K or less in annual income are exempt.

update_detail: Rate increased, threshold introduced, unsweetened water excluded

exclusions: Plain water, plain milk, fresh local fuit drinks without additives

update_detail: Rate lowered in Dec 2018 from US¢50 per gram sugar to US¢30 per gram sugar, extended to cover all SSB. Minimum sugar content threshold of 6g per 100ml on products under HS 2202, and 8g per 100ml on "beverages based on fruit and vegetable juices" introduced in Dec 2020.

update_detail: Rate increased from €0.02/L to €0.06/L on products under HS 2201, and €0.03/L to €0.09/L on HS 2202
products: Sweetened and unsweetened waters under HS 2201 and 2202
rate: €0.09/L on SSB under HS 2202 (excl. milk-based drinks); €0.06/L on unsweetened waters
legislation: Order No. 102 of 15th February 2014; Resolution No. 302 of 9th June 2018

products: Non-alcoholic beverages, including juices, coffee and tea drinks, and concentrates intended for preparation, whether or not containing added sugar or other sweeteners
rate: 10% on fruit and vegetable juices; 14% on artificial mineral water, soda water, soft drinks with and without sugar or other sweeteners and flavors (reduced from previous 20% rate).  Additional specific tax on all drinks with >6 g total sugar per 100 ml: THB 0.10 per liter on SSB containing 6–8g sugar per 100 mL; THB 0.30 per liter on SSB containing 8–10g sugar per 100 ml; THB 0.50 per liter on SSB containing 10–14g sugar per 100 ml; THB 1 on SSB containing >14g sugar per 100 ml. Rate increases every two years until 2023 when following rates will apply: THB 1 per liter on SSB containing 6–8g sugar per 100 ml; THB 3 per liter on SSB containing 8–10g sugar per 100 ml; THB 5 per liter on SSB containing >10 g per 100 ml. Maximum rates applied will be 5 Baht per liter for fruit and vegetable juice, soda, and carbonated drinks and 44 Baht per liter for beverage concentrates.
legislation: Excise Act B.E. 2560 (2017)

products: Waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters, containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavored and other non-alcoholic beverages, other than fruit or vegetable juices falling under heading 20.09
rate: USD$3 per Liter
legislation: General State Budget for 2023 (Law 15/2022)
notes: Tax also applies to sugars and confectionary (HS1701-1704) at USD$1 per kg

products: Non-alcoholic drinks excluding water

products: Full sugar and artificially sweetened soft drinks, energy drinks, and other SSB under HS2202

notes: Tax also applies to specified unhealthy foods.

products: Waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavored and other non-alcoholic drinks (HS 2202); fruit and vegetable juices, unfermented without addition of alcohol, with or without added sugar or other sweeteners (HS 2009), Preparations containing cocoa (HS 1806); Extracts, essences and concentrates of coffee, tea or mate and preparations with a basis of these products or with a basis of coffee, tea, or mate…and extracts, essences, and concentrates thereof (HS 2101); Food preparations not included elsewhere (HS 2106)
rate: 25% on beverages under HS 2009, 2202, and 2101; 10% on beverages under HS 1806 (cocoa-based preparations); 40% on concentrates

update_detail: Extended from 'cola sodas' to include juices and other SSB

exclusions: 100% juice, flavored and plain mineral water

products: All soft drinks under HS 22.02.10.11
exclusions: Juices, milk-based drinks, concentrates, plain water
rate: 30% (plus 25% import duty). Unsweetened water exempt from excise and import duty
legislation: Customs Excise Duties Order 2020
notes: Tax also applies to some unhealthy foods.

products: Non-alcoholic beverages, excluding juice made from at least 30% of pulp from fruit and vegetables grown in Uganda
exclusions: Juice made from at least 30% of pulp from fruit and vegetables grown in Uganda
rate: 12% or UGX 200 per liter, whichever is higher, on non-alcoholic beverages excl. fruit and vegetable juices; 13% or UGX 300 per liter, whichever is higher, on fruit and vegetable juices (excl. juice made from at least 30% of pulp from fruit and vegetables grown in Uganda)
legislation: Excise Duty Act 2014; Excise Duty Amendment Act 2018

update_detail: Extended beyond energy and carbonated drinks to cover all SSB
products: All drinks containing added sugars or sweetener, including concentrate, powder or other substance that is mixed with water to be made into a beverage
exclusions: Plain water, RTD beverages containing at least 75% milk or milk substitutes, 100% juices
rate: 100% on energy drinks; 50% on other soft drinks
legislation: Federal Decree Law Number 7 of 2017 on Excise Tax. Cabinet Decision No. 52 of 2019 on Excise Goods, Excise Tax Rates and the Methods of Calculating the Excise Price.

products: Any prepackaged soft drink with added sugar containing at least 5 g of total sugars per 100 ml. Added sugar defined as mono or disaccharides, or anything (other than fruit juice, vegetable juice and milk) that contains sugar, such as honey
exclusions: Milk-based drinks with >75% milk, milk substitute drinks (e.g. plant based milks), pure fruit juices or any other drinks with no added sugar, alcohol substitute drinks, LCSB, and soft drinks of a specified description which are for use for medicinal or other specified purposes. Producers with <1 million liters/year exempt.
rate: ₤0.18 per liter on drinks with 5–8 g total sugar per 100 ml; ₤0.24 per liter on drinks with >8 g total sugar per 100 ml
legislation: Finance Act 2017, Soft Drinks Industry Levy Regulations 2018

products: All non-alcoholic beverages whether or not containing added sugar or other sweeteners
rate: TShs 232 per L on imported fruit and vegetable juices of HS code 2009, whether or not containing added sugar or other sweeteners (TShs 9 per L on locally-produced equivalents); TShs 64.05 per L on imported waters, including natural or artificial mineral waters and aerated waters, not containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoured; ice and snow of HS code 2201 (TShs 58 per L on locally-produced equivalents); TShs 61 per L on waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters, containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoured of HS code 2202.10; TShs 589-05 per L on imported non-alcoholic beer and other beverages of HS codes 2202.91 and 2202.99 (Tshs 561 on locally-produced equivalents)
legislation: The Finance Act 2018, Part V Amendment of the Excise (Management and Tariff) Act

products: Carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks, sweetened with caloric or non-caloric sweeteners, mineral waters, juices and fruit drinks, energy drinks, concentrates and syrups
rate: Ad valorem tax applied on fixed tax base amounts - precios fictos - per volume varying by beverage category, effectively operating as a specific tax. Precios fictos usually adjusted annually. Adjusted in Dec 2021 (Decreto 443/021) for 2022 year at (per liter): $20.79 for mineral waters and sodas, 32.73 for fresh or reconstituted juices or nectars with minimum 50% fruit juice content, $35.95 for other juice-based drinks, $32.73 for liquid meal replacements, $$57.41 for malts, $35.95 for energy drinks, $7.74 for solid concentrates, $80.33 for non-alcoholic beers. Ad valorem rates currently set at: 8% on mineral waters and sodas, 12% on fresh or reconstituted juices or nectars with minimum 50% fruit juice content, 18% on other juice-based drinks, 12% on energy drinks and liquid meal replacements, 14% on malts, 18% on solid concentrates. Imports are calculated as the fixed value for domestic products multiplied by two, which means that imported products are subject to higher charges
legislation: Decreto No. 96/990 of 21/2/1990 - Reglamentacion del Impuesto Especifico Interno (IMESI); Decree No. 17/996 of 24/1/1996; Decreto 20.019; Ley Nº 17.151 Modificanse los articulos que se determinan del Decreto-Ley Nº 14.416

update_detail: Changed from volume-specific to ad valorem tax
products: Soft drinks containing added sugar or other sweeteners or flavoring; electrolyte/sports drinks
rate: 75% on SSB under HS 2202.10 and 2202.90; 30% on unsweetened waters under HS 2201; 15% on concentrates and syrups under HS 2106.90; 20% on juices under HS 2009
legislation: Republic of Vanuatu. Import Duties (Consolidation) (Amendment) Act No. 33 of 2014

products: Waters, including mineral waters and aerated waters, containing added sugar or other sweetening matter or flavoured, and other nonalcoholic beverages (HS 2202.10 and HS 2202.90)
exclusions: Fruit and vegetable juices, whether or not containing added sugar or other sweetening matter; Plain water; Milk
rate: VT 50 per liter
legislation: Vanuatu Excise Act, Consolidated Edition 2015, Chapter 290

products: All beverages under HS 2202, 2201, 2106, 2009
rate: 30% on sweetened beverages; 4% on unsweetened bottled water, concentrates, and 100% juices
legislation: Art. 28 of the National Customs Code; Tarif des Douanes

products: Soft drinks and non-alcoholic beverages other than fruit or vegetable juices and dairy products
exclusions: Fruit and vegetable juices, dairy-based drinks
rate: $0.10 per 12 fl. oz or less and $0.15 per container of more than 12 fl. oz
legislation: 1979 State Tax Act, 1987 Yap State Code, 2000 Yap State Code (Title 13, Ch 1)

products: Sweetened waters under HS2202
rate: K0.30/ltr (or onesixth (5 ngwee per liter) when locally manufactured)
legislation: Customs and Excise Amendment Act No. 19 of 2018
